newsitem.title: NAMIBIA: SOCCER-URI KHOB REMAINS NAMIBIA HERO.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-URI KHOB REMAINS NAMIBIA HERO.

text.p: Striker Gervatius Uri Khob scored a goal and made two more in Namibia's 4-1 win over Malawi in a Cosafa Castle Cup tie on Saturday.

Uri Khob, whose goals gave Namibia shock away wins over Liberia in the World Cup and Kenya in the African Nations' Cup qualifiers this month, scored with a close-in header after 35 minutes to put Namibia 1-0 at halftime.
He then created goals in the second half for captain Sandro de Gouveia and substitute Johannes Hindjou before Eliphas Shivute added a fourth in the 75th minute.
Lovemore Fazili scored a late consolation for Malawi.
Namibia now have four points from two matches, the same as leaders Mozambique, in the newly-launched five-team competition for members of the Confederation of Southern African Football Associations.

Namibia - 1-Fillemon Kanalelo; 2-Petrus Haraseb, 14-Stanley Gogoaseb, 5-Bimbo Tjihero; 12-Mohammed Ouseb (18-Paul Bostander 73), 10-Ricardo Mannetti, 4-Frans Ananias, 3-Eliphas Shivute (9-Riaan van Wyk 83), 7-Sandro de Gouveia; 6-Silvester oraseb (15-Johannes Hindjou 69), 8-Gervatius Uri Khob.

Malawi - 12-Ganizani Masiye; 4-Felix Nyirongo, 5-George Martin, 14-Walter Nyamilandu; 2-Charles Manda, 8-Manson Shabba Phiri (3-Laurent Kamanga 47), 6-Hendrix Banda, 10-Chance Gondwe, 7-Albert Mpinganjira; 11-Chimwemwe Gadi (9-Leonard Malunga 55), 16-Lovemore Fazili.
